key_title: Key to the species of Datura

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Solanaceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Solanaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Solanaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves lobed, lobes usually toothed or sinuate; capsule erect; seeds black or grey
Leaves entire to sinuate, if lobed then lobes entire; capsule deflexed; seeds brown or yellow
Corolla 4.5–6 cm long; capsule usually with 40–60 stout spines, the upper ones longer than the lower
Corolla 6–10 cm long; capsule with more than 100 slender spines of various lengths and evenly distributed
Plant tomentose with erect glandular hairs; stigma below level of anthers; margin of corolla limb angular
Plant tomentose mainly with retrorse simple hairs, some erect glandular hairs usually present; stigma well above level of anthers; margin of corolla limb rounded
